channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MS

item.title: Report E-2023080939
item.description:
Report E-2023080939

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-27
  • City: LAKE
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 27, 2023, at 1618 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Lake, Mississippi regarding the release of approximately (1) gallon of AUW7 102 (UN1263, 3, II) from (1) 5-gallon plastic pail. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release was contained to the trailer floor, and the surrounding concrete. Contractors cleaned the release with the proper PPE, and all waste generated was containerized in (1) 55-gallon metal drum which was then taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

THE LEAKAGE WAS ABSORBED THROUGHOUT THE CARDBOARD BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PROPERLY HANDLED USING THE CORRECT HAZARDOUS MATERIALS THAT WAS NEEDED AT THE TIME.

item.title: Report E-2023080773
item.description:
Report E-2023080773

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-21
  • City: MERIDIAN
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 21, 2023 at 2141 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contracted by Landstar personnel in Meridian, Mississippi regarding the release of approximately (20) gallons of AFCO 4363 Persafe 23 UN3109, 5.2, II) from (1) 330-gallon IBC plastic tote. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release was contained to an area on the trailer and a 1’x20’ area on surrounding concrete The release was cleaned up with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (2) 55-gallon DF, which was then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.
